title: Test and complete POSIX filesystem operations
description: POSIX filesystem constants and functions are declared in src/analyzer.ts and src/posix_constants.ts but need integration testing. Multiple test_posix_*.algol files exist.

title: Fix test_posix_seek_sync.algol - fix buffer and offset types
description: Test has buffer casting issues and possibly offset type mismatches. Update to use proper array passing.

title: Add break and continue statements
description: Implement break and continue statements for loop control. break exits the innermost loop, continue skips to the next iteration. Must work with while loops, for loops, and for-each loops.

title: Fix test_posix_truncate.algol - fix truncate length parameter
description: Truncate test fails. Check length parameter type and buffer handling for truncate/ftruncate calls.

title: Fix test_posix_read.algol - remove cast<i64> from buffer parameter
description: The test uses cast<i64>(buffer) but read() expects ptr. Update to pass array directly without casting.

title: GC: Add GCHeader and ObjectKind infrastructure
description:
Replace current Block singly-linked list with header-based allocations. Add GCHeader struct with size, kind, flags, marked, next, prev fields. Implement ObjectKind enum for different object types. Add mark stack for non-recursive marking.

Acceptance Criteria:
- GCHeader struct defined in runtime.c
- ObjectKind enum (ARRAY, TABLE, STRING, SMALL_OBJECT, etc.)
- Mark stack implementation (dynamic array)
- Replace Block list with header-based heap
- All existing tests still pass
close_reason: Implemented: ObjectKind enum, GCHeader with kind field, mark stack for non-recursive marking

title: Add string manipulation functions
description: Add string concatenation, length, substring functions. Currently strings can be literals but have no manipulation functions beyond print_string.

title: Fix test_posix_time.algol - define timespec structure for utimensat
description: Time test fails due to timespec structure issues. Define proper array layout for timespec with tv_sec and tv_nsec fields.

title: Implement Semantic Analyzer
description: Perform type checking, lexical scoping, block scoping validation, and resolve function/table operations

title: Implement Array Operations
description: N-dimensional array allocation, indexing, and vector/matrix native syntax operations

title: Implement Standard Library Builtins
description: Math, string, array, and table utility operations

title: Fix test_posix_basic.algol - fix buffer passing
description: Basic POSIX test has buffer casting issues. Update to pass arrays without cast<i64>().

title: Implement LLM Map Operation
description: Optimized mapping of LLM calls over arrays/tables

title: GC: Implement large-object allocator with mmap
description:
Create page-aware large-object allocator for nd-array data. Route large allocations (>= threshold) through mmap/VirtualAlloc. Keep headers in small heap, data in separate page-aligned mapping. Add reuse cache for freed mappings to reduce churn.

Acceptance Criteria:
- GCLarge struct for large object metadata
- mmap-based allocation path for large objects
- Configurable large object threshold (default: 1 page)
- array_alloc routes large arrays through mmap path
- Reuse cache for freed large objects
- Optional madvise(MADV_HUGEPAGE) for very large arrays
close_reason: Implemented: large_object_alloc with mmap/VirtualAlloc, page-aligned allocations, mapping cache for reuse, LARGE_OBJECT_THRESHOLD=4KB

title: Add for-each loop syntax
description: Implement for-each loops: 'for item: type in array { ... }' to iterate over arrays without index. Must require explicit type annotation for the loop variable. Should work with arrays of any dimension and element type.

title: GC: Add growth policy and statistics
description:
Implement proper GC growth policy based on live bytes. Track allocated_bytes and live_bytes per space. Threshold formula: next_threshold = max(min_threshold, live_bytes * growth_factor). Add GC stats logging for debugging/monitoring.

Acceptance Criteria:
- allocated_bytes and live_bytes tracking
- Growth policy with configurable min threshold and factor
- GC stats struct with collection count, bytes freed, etc.
- Stats logging function (gc_print_stats)
- Handle allocation failure with retry after collection
close_reason: Implemented: gc_allocated_bytes/live_bytes tracking, growth policy with factor and min threshold, gc_stats logging

title: Implement Parser
description: Parse tokens into AST with Algol syntax, block scoping, and no operator precedence enforcement

title: Fix test_posix_access.algol - fix buffer handling
description: Test uses cast on buffer parameters. Remove casts and pass arrays directly to access() and related functions.

title: Implement Map Operation
description: Efficient map over arrays/tables with loop-level performance

title: Design Language Specification
description: Define AlgolScript syntax, type system, semantics, and LLM operation API

title: Implement Table Operations
description: Lua-like table creation, indexing, iteration, and efficient map operation

title: Add compiler error for cast with POSIX functions
description: Optional: Add analyzer warning when cast<i64>() is used with POSIX function buffer parameters to guide users.

title: Add slice syntax for n-dimensional arrays
description: Implement array slicing syntax: arr[start:end] to extract subarrays. Should work for 1D, 2D, and n-dimensional arrays. Return a new array/view containing the sliced elements. Must preserve type safety with no implicit coercion.

title: Create POSIX test suite summary document
description: Create a document listing all POSIX tests, their status, and what each tests (reference documentation).

title: Fix test_posix_comprehensive.algol - fix buffer passing syntax
description: Multiple POSIX functions use cast<i64>(buffer) but expect ptr. Update all buffer parameters to pass arrays directly.

title: GC: Implement shadow-stack API for root tracking
description:
Implement shadow-stack API for precise root tracking. Add gc_push_frame/gc_pop_frame functions. GCFrame struct with prev, count, slots[]. Update LLVM codegen to emit frame push/pop and root slot tracking.

Acceptance Criteria:
- GCFrame struct and shadow stack implementation
- gc_push_frame() / gc_pop_frame() functions
- Globals registration via gc_register_global()
- Compiler emits frame setup/teardown in function prologue/epilogue
- Root slots populated for heap reference locals
close_reason: Implemented: GCFrame struct, gc_push_frame/gc_pop_frame functions, gc_add_root API, shadow stack walking in gc_mark_roots

title: Fix test_posix_stat.algol - define proper stat buffer structure
description: Stat test fails because stat buffer structure layout is not properly defined. Need to define statbuf as i64[] with correct size for stat structure fields.

title: Fix test_posix_links.algol - fix symlink buffer handling
description: Links test fails due to buffer handling in symlink functions. Update readlink and symlink buffer parameters.

title: Implement LLM Built-in

title: Fix test_posix_control.algol - fix fcntl argument types
description: Control test has fcntl() argument type issues. Check and fix the argument passing for fcntl commands.

title: Implement Lexer/Tokenizer
description: Tokenize Algol-68 style syntax including block delimiters, operators, array/table syntax, and LLM call keywords

title: Add POSIX examples to README
description: Add working POSIX examples to README showing proper buffer passing and common patterns.

title: Implement Memory Manager with GC
description: Simple mark-and-sweep or reference counting GC for tables and arrays

title: GC: Add tracing for Array and Table types
description:
Implement proper marking traversal for complex types. Arrays need to mark dims/strides and element pointers (for reference arrays). Tables need to mark buckets, entries, keys, and pointer-tagged values. Introduce Value tagging system.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Array tracing marks data, dims, strides
- Table tracing marks buckets, entries, keys
- Value tagging system for pointer vs primitive table values
- Trace function or kind-based switch for marking
- Handles nested structures (array of tables, table of arrays)
close_reason: Implemented: gc_trace_array, gc_trace_table, gc_trace_table_entry, proper marking of nested structures, OBJ_ARRAY/OBJ_TABLE/OBJ_ENTRY kinds

title: Fix table member assignment
description: Enable table member assignment syntax like person.age := 31. Currently fails with 'Invalid assignment target'. Parser needs to handle MemberExpression as assignment target.

title: Fix test_posix_directory_read.algol - fix rewinddir pointer handling
description: Directory reading test fails because rewinddir() expects ptr but receives i64. Fix directory pointer variable type.

title: Add string interpolation syntax
description: Implement string interpolation: "Hello, {variable}!" syntax for embedding expressions in strings. Must require explicit type and only support string-compatible types (strings, integers for to-string conversion). No implicit coercion - user must explicitly convert non-string types.

title: Implement Type System
description: Define i/u8-256 integer types, f8-f256 float types, array types, table types, and string-as-array-of-u8

title: Verify all 17 POSIX tests pass after fixes
description: After fixing individual test files, run all 17 test_posix_*.algol files and verify they all pass.

title: Implement Code Generator
description: Generate bytecode or target format from AST with efficient array/table operations

title: Document POSIX variadic function workaround for macOS
description: Document that open() with O_CREAT fails on macOS ARM64 due to variadic calling convention. Users should use creat() instead.
